label: Village study year
definition: Year study village was surveyed
codebookDescription: variable, derived

label: Study year
definition: Study year
codebookDescription: Study Year; Country-wide
notesForOnt: This study was conducted over 5 years. There were 4 intervention years and a final year of data collection.

label: Study arm
definition: Treatment frequency: either annual or biannual after study redesign
codebookDescription: Treatment: annual or biannual after study redesign
codebookValues: CWT once= communitywide treatment once a year; CWT twice= communitywide treatment twice a year; SBT once= school-based treatment once a year; SBT twice= school-based treatment twice a year.
notesForOnt: Once the Niger study was redesigned, the new study aimed to compare once a year versus twice a year treatment in villages.

label: Study type
definition: A1= Villages with a starting prevalence of 10-24% during eligibility testing that got school-based treatment once a year; A2= Villages with a starting prevalence of 10-24% during eligibility testing that got school-based treatment twice a year; B1= Villages with a starting prevalence of ≥25% during eligibility testing that got school-based treatment once a year; B2= Villages with a starting prevalence of ≥25% during eligibility testing that got school-based treatment twice a year; C1= Villages with a starting prevalence of ≥25% during eligibility testing that got communitywide treatment once a year; C2= Villages with a starting prevalence of ≥25% during eligibility testing that got communitywide treatment twice a year
codebookDescription: Study group after Niger study was redesigned
codebookValues: A1= Villages with a starting prevalence of 10-24% during eligibility testing that got school-based treatment once a year; A2= Villages with a starting prevalence of 10-24% during eligibility testing that got school-based treatment twice a year; B1= Villages with a starting prevalence of ≥25% during eligibility testing that got school-based treatment once a year; B2= Villages with a starting prevalence of ≥25% during eligibility testing that got school-based treatment twice a year; C1= Villages with a starting prevalence of ≥25% during eligibility testing that got communitywide treatment once a year; C2= Villages with a starting prevalence of ≥25% during eligibility testing that got communitywide treatment twice a year
notesForOnt: Please refer to study design diagram (in study details doc) for details on study group.

label: Village code
definition: A unique ID assigned to each study village. It represents the country code followed by a unique three digit number.
codebookDescription: A unique ID assigned to each study village. It represents the country code followed by a unique three digit number.

label: Longitude (degrees)
definition: GPS coordinates (latitude and longitude) of schools for each village
codebookDescription: Village level; GPS coordinates (latitude and longitude) of schools for each village

label: Latitude (degrees)
definition: GPS coordinates (latitude and longitude) of schools for each village
codebookDescription: Village level; GPS coordinates (latitude and longitude) of schools for each village

label: Number of school-age children (SAC) in village
definition: Number of school-age children (SAC) in village
codebookDescription: Village level; # school-age children (SAC) in village
notesForOnt: This variable and the following 9 variables provide data about MDA (drug treatment) coverage, ie, what proportion of the target population got the intended treatment.

label: Number of school-age children treated in village
definition: # school-age children (SAC) treated in first treatment
codebookDescription: Village level;# school-age children (SAC) treated

label: Percent school-age children treated in village
definition: Percent school-age children (SAC) treated in village in first treatment. Calculated by dividing SAC_Rxed_Rx1 by Total_SAC
codebookDescription: Village level; school-age children (SAC) treated in village

label: Number of school-age children (SAC) in village, second treatment
definition: # school-age children (SAC) treated in second treatment
codebookDescription: Village level;# school-age children (SAC) treated

label: Percent school-age children treated in village, second treatment
definition: Percent school-age children (SAC) treated in village. Calculated by dividing SAC_Rxed_Rx2 by Total_SAC
codebookDescription: Village level; school-age children (SAC) treated in village

label: Total population of village
definition: Total population of village
codebookDescription: Village level; Total population of village

label: Total population treated in village
definition: Total population treated in first treatment
codebookDescription: Village level; Total population treated

label: Percent total population treated in village
definition: Percent total population treated in village in first treatment. Calculated by dividing Total_Pop_Rxed_Rx1 by Total_Pop
codebookDescription: Village level; Percent total population treated in village

label: Total population treated in village, second treatment
definition: Total population treated in second treatment
codebookDescription: Village level; Total population treated

label: Percent total population treated in village, second treatment
definition: Percent total population treated in village. Calculated by dividing Total_Pop_Rxed_Rx2 by Total_Pop
codebookDescription: Village level; Percent total population treated in village

label: Sex
definition: Sex
codebookDescription: Sex

label: Age at enrollment
definition: Age in years
codebookDescription: Age (years)

label: Age group at enrollment
definition: Age group
codebookDescription: Generated based on age: 5_8= 5-8 years old, 9_12= 9 to 12 years old, 20_55= 20 to 55 years old, Other= not in above age groups
notesForOnt: In SCORE studies, 9 to 12 year old participants were the target population under study. In addition, we also looked at 5 to 8 year old (considered "first years" because they just entered school and have not had the opportunity to have school-based treatment yet) and adults (we only included those between ages of 20 and 55 in our adult category).

label: Schistosoma haematobium (per 10 ml), by microscopy
definition: Mean Schistosoma haematobium eggs counted on the two filtrations of the urine sample
codebookDescription: Mean Schistosoma haematobium eggs counted on the two filtrations of the urine sample
notesForOnt: Arithmetic mean of the two preceding variables.

label: Schistosoma haematobium, by microscopy
definition: Presence or absence of Schistosoma haematobium infection in this study participant, based on detection of at least one egg in the urine sample.
codebookDescription: Presence or absence of Schistosoma haematobium infection in this study participant, based on detection of at least one egg in the urine sample.
notesForOnt: This variable gives binary (yes/no) measure of S. haematobium infection in this study participant.

label: Country
definition: Country in which study was conducted
codebookDescription: Country; Country wide
